event: Here is the table of events and timestamps:
breath sounds reduced in the lower segments of the lungs
bilateral peripheral ground-glass attenuation and patchy consolidation
focal area of subpleural infiltration with a central cavity of destruction
air layer up to 47 mm of anteroposterior thickness
pleural effusion with 25 mm of anteroposterior depth
air layer up to 19 mm of anteroposterior thickness
needle thoracocentesis and new pleural drainage
air and creamy purulent mass aspirated
chest CT showed air and pleural effusion in the right hemithorax
right pleural space irrigated with antiseptic solutions
lung expansion by continuous vacuum aspiration technique
new drainage of the pleural cavity
chest CT showed the presence of the encapsulated pleural effusion
chest CT showed a small amount of fluid in the right pleural cavity
lab test scores returned to normal range
